FlowGraph
Table of Contents

Class NodeVisualManager

Namespace
FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering
Assembly
FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll

Manages rendering and tracking of node and port visuals. Responsible for creating, updating, and removing node/port UI elements. Uses GraphRenderModel for all geometry calculations to ensure visual parity with DirectCanvasRenderer.

public class NodeVisualManager
Inheritance
object
NodeVisualManager
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.MemberwiseClone()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()

Remarks

This class is split across multiple files for organization:

  • NodeVisualManager - Core fields, constructor, basic accessors
  • NodeVisualManager.Ports.cs - Port state management and animations
  • NodeVisualManager.Rendering.cs - Node and port rendering methods
  • NodeVisualManager.Positioning.cs - Position updates and coordinate calculations
  • NodeVisualManager.Editing.cs - Inline label editing

Constructors

NodeVisualManager(RenderContext, NodeRendererRegistry?, PortRendererRegistry?)

Creates a new node visual manager.

public NodeVisualManager(RenderContext renderContext, NodeRendererRegistry? nodeRendererRegistry = null, PortRendererRegistry? portRendererRegistry = null)

Parameters

renderContext RenderContext

Shared render context.

nodeRendererRegistry NodeRendererRegistry

Registry for custom node renderers. If null, a default registry is created.

portRendererRegistry PortRendererRegistry

Registry for custom port renderers. If null, a default registry is created.

Returns

Point

The port position in canvas coordinates.

GetPortScreenPosition(Node, Port, bool)

Gets the screen position of a port using GraphRenderModel.

[Obsolete("Use GetPortViewportPosition or GetPortCanvasPosition instead. 'Screen' terminology was ambiguous.")]
public Point GetPortScreenPosition(Node node, Port port, bool isOutput)

Parameters

node Node
port Port
isOutput bool

Returns

Point

GetPortViewportPosition(Node, Port, bool)

Gets the viewport position of a port using GraphRenderModel.

public Point GetPortViewportPosition(Node node, Port port, bool isOutput)

Parameters

node Node

The parent node.

port Port

The port.

isOutput bool

True if this is an output port.

Returns

Point

The port position in viewport coordinates.

Remarks

WARNING: This returns viewport-relative coordinates, NOT screen/control coordinates. For distance calculations with pointer events, prefer using GetPortCanvasPosition(Node, Port, bool) and comparing in canvas space, since pointer events give canvas coords via e.GetPosition(MainCanvas).

RenderNodes(Canvas, Graph, ThemeResources, Action<Control, Node>?)

Renders all nodes in the graph to the canvas. Groups are rendered first (behind), then regular nodes. Nodes hidden by collapsed groups are not rendered. When virtualization is enabled, only nodes in the visible viewport are rendered.

public void RenderNodes(Canvas canvas, Graph graph, ThemeResources theme, Action<Control, Node>? onNodeCreated = null)

Parameters

canvas Canvas

The canvas to render to.

graph Graph

The graph containing nodes.

theme ThemeResources

Theme resources for styling.

onNodeCreated Action<Control, Node>

Optional callback when a node visual is created.

node Node

Index of this port among siblings.

totalPorts int

isOutput bool

Optional callback when the port visual is created.

UpdateAllNodePositions(Graph)

Updates all existing node visuals to their current screen positions. This is an optimized path for viewport changes (pan/zoom) that avoids recreating the visual tree. Only updates positions, not visual properties. NOTE: With transform-based rendering, this method is no longer needed for viewport changes. It's kept for compatibility but should only be called when nodes actually move in canvas space.

public void UpdateAllNodePositions(Graph graph)

Parameters

graph Graph

The graph containing the nodes.

UpdateAllPortStates(Graph, ThemeResources)

Updates the visual state of all ports in the graph based on their connection status. This should be called after rendering to ensure animated ports start their animations. Detects state changes to trigger one-shot animations (e.g., ripple on connect).

public void UpdateAllPortStates(Graph graph, ThemeResources theme)

Parameters

graph Graph

The graph containing the nodes and edges.

theme ThemeResources

The current theme.
